qas.question: What was being built that caused unpremeditated fighting on each side?

answers.text: forward rifle pits and defensive positions

qas.question: What month did the capture of Malakoff take place?
Who failed to take back Malakoff?
Who took control of the Great Redan?

context: For months each side had been building <a0_0>forward rifle pits and defensive positions<a0_0/>, which resulted in many skirmishes. Artillery fire aiming to gain superiority over the enemy guns.:450–462 September saw the final assault. On 5 <a1_0>September<a1_0/>, another French bombardment (the sixth) was followed by an assault by the French Army on 8 September resulting in the capture of the Malakoff by <a2_0>the French<a2_0/>, and following their failure to retake it, the collapse of <a3_0>the Russian defences<a3_0/>. Meanwhile, <a4_0>the British<a4_0/> captured the Great Redan, just south of the city of Sevastopol. The Russians retreated to the north, blowing up their magazines and the city fell on 9 September 1855 after a 337-day-long siege.:106
